item.description: On account of the Indian currency situation being in tatters, I only have 2 avenues for my year-end ‚Äúthank you & go on‚Äù donations - #NixOS Foundation & #Haskell Org.

item.description: Had a really good time last evening at local Blr Haskell Meetup. Went after a long time and it‚Äôs inspiring to see a thriving Haskell community. Shout out to @puffnfresh @hk_hooda

item.description: I sigh at those startup founders who propagandise quitting social media just coz they can‚Äôt control their impulses. How do they expect people (esp. the VCs) to trust them running a business ! #douchebags

item.description: As my micro blogs contain more than one link the automatic cross-posting to Twitter goes haywire. But it‚Äôs a trade off I can live with.
item.dc:creator: Kaushik Chakraborty

item.description:
I‚Äôve griped in the past [3,4] but this unnecessary grudge cycle against RSS comes back. Brent Simmons‚Äô [2] latest explanation [1] is another good reminder - leave RSS alone!

[1] http://inessential.com/2018/09/17/oh_god_not_this_again

[2] https://micro.blog/brentsimmons

[3] https://twitter.com/kaychaks/status/980797708314148865

[4] https://kaushikc.org/linked/heil-rss.html
item.dc:creator: Kaushik Chakraborty

item.description:
A decent rant by Nikita (creator of the font Fira Code) on the apalling state of the art with modern softwares. There is a bit of trivialization but overall a required call for action.

Software disenchantment
item.dc:creator: Kaushik Chakraborty

item.description: Pretty accurate modern version of 7 deadly sins via THErealDVORAK in the recent No Agenda newsletter, the best podcast in the universe.
item.dc:creator: Kaushik Chakraborty

item.description:
Rarely I agree to Guardian‚Äôs views but this one on US Open Ladies Final drama is spot on

But none of that excuses what Williams did in the Arthur Ashe Stadium on Saturday night ‚Äì which was to manipulate sentiment to her advantage,

item.description:
Google wants to kill the URL and Wired is complicit in their propaganda by writing this stupid article. I‚Äôve lost most hope from Google where engineering managers say dumb things like

People have a really hard time understanding URLs

but Wired also have this gem of a loose statement (without any evidence)

If you‚Äôre having a tough time thinking of what could possibly be used in place of URLs, you‚Äôre not alone. Academics have considered options over the years, but the problem doesn‚Äôt have an easy answer.
item.dc:creator: Kaushik Chakraborty
